page.title: 04Shopping in Collingham
page.content: The shops in Collingham sell{everyday {goods}such as food and drink.There is also a newsagent,and a motorist's shop.For clothes and shoes which are called{occasional goods}people tend to go to Newark,Nottingham or Lincoln,but if just a few things are needed like cheese eggs and butter,the Collingham shops are used.One shop owner said that it was hard for a small shop to be competitive.He collects his goods from the large towns in a van.The shop's busiest day is Friday,as people are buying in for the weekend. There are the least number of shops in Collingham this century.{16 shops have {closed in the last 30 years}as better transport facilities have provided easier access to Newark and Lincoln.
